## Versionskontrolle mit Git

The cartoon below depicts a situation that is probably only too well known to many of us.
After weeks of hard labor writing a term paper/thesis/article, we were finally confident enough to call it a day
and name the file "FINAL.doc". However... final is often not _really_ final, is it?

!["notFinal.doc" - originally published 10/12/2012, Piled Higher and Deeper by Jorge Cham [www.phdcomics.com](https://phdcomics.com/comics/archive_print.php?comicid=1531)](img/phd101212s.png){width=50%}

Git probably the most popular software for version control
and used in millions of software projects. 
Here, we'll learn the basics of this mighty tool 
that can help us to manage our musicology project project.

![[A successful Git branching](https://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/) model by Vincent Driessen](img/git_model.png)

### Tutorials

1. The most comprehensive resource is the [Pro Git Book](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2)
2. A concise and graphical introduction to the most important stages of the git workflow can be found in [git - the simple guide](http://rogerdudler.github.io/git-guide/)
3. Another visual, but more explicit reference is [A Visual Git Reference](https://marklodato.github.io/visual-git-guide/index-en.html)
4. Finally, [Git Immersion](https://gitimmersion.com/) is a full-fledged tutorial.
